Description: Four fragments of a Fikellura painted pottery neck-amphora (Tarquinia Group). Shoulder, probably sphinx, goat, sphinx. Belly, open cable (with ring around central dot): lotus flowers and buds, double. Purple dots at base of buds. With 1888,0208.55b and 1924,1201.1060.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Tell Dafana, "Qasr", east annex (G), chamber 18
Curator's comments: With BM GR 1888,0208.55.b. Findspot number '18' scratched onto the reverse surface of 1888,0208.56.d (and 1888,0208.55.b) From a pot larger than usual. BSA xxxiv, 10 (D 2), 72. Attributed to the Tarquinia Group
Bibliographic references: CVA British Museum 8 / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum: Great Britain 13, British Museum 8 (Pl. GB 576, 8)
Weber 2012 / Untersuchungen zur archaischen griechischen Keramik aus anderen ägyptischen Fundorten (TD 223)
Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.210)
